claim: Official docs state JSON is standardized in RFC 8259 and Boost.JSON implements this standard.
notes: RFC 8259 is the current JSON standard

claim: Boost.JSON does not allow byte order marks (BOM) in JSON text as per RFC specification.
notes: RFC 8259 prohibits BOM in JSON text

claim: Library provides parse_options to allow non-standard JSON extensions as opt-in features.
Boost.JSON is a C++11 library for parsing and serializing JSON to DOM containers.
Library includes comprehensive test suite for validation and compliance testing.
